name: 01-Project Overview
content:
Objective

The primary goal of the CPG-Churn-Prediction-B2B project is to identify and predict potential customer churn within distributor–customer relationships in the consumer packaged goods (CPG) sector. Churn prediction enables businesses to proactively engage with at-risk customers, strengthen long-term relationships, and reduce revenue loss caused by customer attrition. By leveraging transactional, product, customer, and distributor data, this project aims to build a predictive model that flags customers likely to stop or reduce purchasing activity in the near future.

Approach

The project follows a structured data science workflow:

  1. Data Ingestion & Integration — Collecting and merging transactional, customer, product, and distributor datasets.
  2. Data Profiling & Cleaning — Ensuring data quality through checks for missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies.
  3. Feature Engineering — Creating customer-level attributes such as purchase frequency, recency, product mix, and discount sensitivity.
  4. Exploratory Analysis — Identifying churn-related behavioral patterns and purchase trends.
  5. Model Training & Evaluation — Training supervised learning models (e.g., Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, Logistic Regression) to predict churn probability.
  6. Deployment & Monitoring — Integrating predictions into business workflows and monitoring model performance over time.

Significance

Churn management is critical in B2B CPG markets where customer acquisition costs are high, and relationships often span years. Early detection of at-risk customers allows distributors to implement retention strategies such as targeted discounts, personalized offers, or improved service. This project provides actionable insights that directly link data-driven decision-making with business continuity.

Benefits

  • Financial: Reduce revenue loss by retaining high-value customers.
  • Operational: Improve distributor–customer engagement strategies and resource allocation.
  • Strategic: Strengthen long-term customer relationships and maintain competitive advantage.
  • Predictive Advantage: Anticipate churn behavior instead of reacting to lost customers.

Expected Outcomes

  • A churn prediction model with measurable accuracy and recall rates.
  • Identification of key churn drivers (e.g., declining purchase frequency, heavy reliance on discounts).
  • Customer churn risk scores at the distributor–customer level.
  • Business dashboards highlighting churn trends and at-risk segments.
  • A framework for ongoing monitoring and retraining of the churn model.
